website_summaries.verdict: Regardless of the task, this mallet will get the job done and provide superior comfort while you're using it.
pros: This mallet offers a round, state-of-the-art design that's comfortable and easy to grip
Has earned praise for its usefulness in woodworking projects
cons: Very rare reports of quality control issues, including damaged handles upon arrival, but most mallets are designed with quality workmanship

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been woodworking for 6 years and always made my own mallets out of scrap wood and off cuts. I even made really fancy ones out of ebony cocobolo etc.... I never thought that a cheap mallet like this would be such a game changer. I do a lot of hand tool work and this mallet has made my work so much more efficient that I felt the need to go out of my way to write a review. It transfers all the energy to the chisel and leaves deapens a marking gauge line 4 times the amount I would get with a wood mallet. If I lost this I would buy it again without thinking
customer_reviews.author: Henry Tawil

customer_reviews.title: Mallet "strikes" a balance
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few shop made mallets in the past but all of them have the same drawback...either too heavy or too light or they tend to be awkward and too bulky for continual use. The Wood Is Good mallet solves both problems. I purchased the 18 oz. mallet. It strikes a good balance between heft and control. It's light enough for delicate chisel work yet beefy enough to chop mortises. The urethane coating really shines when striking a chisel...no bounce, no slipping, just a solid strike. I have added grip tape to the handle on my mallet which aids in controlling mallet strikes. I would definitely recommend this mallet to any serious wood worker.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great maul, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this maul for use doing leather crafting. After using it for a few weeks, I have to say I am very pleased. The tool does a fine job on the various metal tools I regularly use. There is just enough weight in the tool to make tooling jobs easier and the material on the head of the maul has held up without any damage. The overall construction seems well done and the handle is incredibly smooth. Very pleased, especially for the price since premium mauls for leather craft can easily be twice the price of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, doesn't damage, and has great force, cannot ask for anything better for installing flooring
customer_reviews.text: I have been putting in laminate flooring with a hammer, which made for a lot of noise and also chipped up the tap block. I eventually bought this and there is definitely a might and day difference. While both get the job done, this does so without marring the tap block and without creating a deafening sound. If I would have seen this when I first started, the flooring project would have been easier. This definitely makes the install easier. Taps well without the noise or damage, what more can you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Wag More, Bark Less

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, great function
customer_reviews.text: I needed a mallet for both chisel work, and helping fit together multiple mortise and tenon joints on a trestle table. I chose the 18oz model and I love it. I've been using it for a couple months now and it doesn't have a mark on it. The handle is so smooth and comfortable it makes hours of use a pleasure. I'm all for the beauty of wooden hand made mallets, but for function this is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: tech77

customer_reviews.title: All Around Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: It has great heft, the handle is maple and unfinished, so you can choose what you want to do. I put Teak Oil finish on it for durability and it looked amazing. Well balanced, and perfect for whacking chisel handles, synthetic or wood. Buy it. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hill

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable mallet
customer_reviews.text: The 12 oz version would have been a little better for my typical usage, e.g., chiseling and some wood carving. The 18 oz version is just a bit too heavy for my purposes. But, that's my preference and definitely doesn't reflect on the overall build quality of the mallet. It's very well made and should last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to workshop!
customer_reviews.text: The craftsmanship in mallet is fantastic! It’s nice to find tools that are designed with the end user in mind, with no shortcuts in the manufacturing or materials used. One of my tools that will be on my workbench and remain there for my kids. No damage or sign of wear after several projects. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: G Henry

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? This thing works that much better?
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woodworking novice and was using a hammer and rubber mallet when working with chisels which provided a craptastic experience. Decided to try this mallet and the difference is amazing. Seriously. This mallet works worlds better, delivering deeper cuts and doesn't ruin the striking end of my chisels. Also very easy to control. I'm honestly impressed, though not surprised the right tool does a better job than the wrong tools I was using (hammer / rubber mallet).
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Weight is stated by Wood is Good to be around 18oz., actual 19 5/8 oz.; I wanted between 18 oz. and 20 oz. for leathercraft punch work. The handle is very comfortable, especially when held close to the head for better control and the strike is solid with no rebound. Highly recommend this maul.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Aliano

customer_reviews.title: The best mallet.
customer_reviews.text: The 18oz is the "Jack All" mallet. Slightly on the heavy side for carving, but still great. I'd go for the 30 oz for joinery chisels. There is a few rough spots on the handle, this may have been just a missed quality item on mine. A little sandpaper takes care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It is a nice wt. for me. Seems to be well built, I have not had it very long, but so far so good. Mallets for personal, you have to try them to know. This one worked nicely foe me. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this for months. Its great! I use it to chop , pare, and assemble/ disassemble joints. Best part is- its quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Irving Arenas

customer_reviews.title: Can't get any better mallet than these
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years. Much better for dovetailing than a traditional wood mallet; indestructible and well balanced. I always scuff up the handle a bit, as it's kind of slick.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is made of smooth straight-grained wood with a urethane wrap bonded to the striking area. The urethane does not mar the chisel handles, so is better than a wooden mallet. The urethane also deforms slightly when striking the chisel handle, theoretically to spread the impact on the handle. This does not seem to lessen the blow. I have the 18 ounce mallet, which is a good compromise of small size to lessen fatigue, and enough weight that you can do decently heavy work. The handle is comfortable to hold. This mallet should last for many years, offsetting the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased this mallet. I'll be able to get a lot of use from it. Fast shipping. Item as described. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: This Wood is Good mallet is great!
customer_reviews.text: I've needed a mallet for woodworks and this mallet is perfect. Nicely balanced, great feel in the hand and just the right weight.
customer_reviews.author: rkanatzar

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great mallet pretty much has replaced my regular black rubber mallets around the shop
customer_reviews.author: My

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mallet. It is well made, comfortable and easy to use. Feels substantial when you hold and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC MALLET!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT mallet. Quality wood, good heft and weight. Did some light work with it, it worked exceptionally well. This item is recommended to regular to heavy work for those preferring the smaller diameter head per the tag that came with it. very happy, quiet, transfers that blows well, no sign of marks or marring on either the matter or the tools being struck. Over all I would HIGHLY recommend this mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grey

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding mallet!
customer_reviews.text: I use this mallet ALL THE TIME. I use it for woodworking (chiseling out mortises, etc) and for general carpentry (aligning structural members). It's a simple tool, but is amazingly useful. It fits well in the hand, is perfectly balanced and the rubber covering is very sturdy. Well worth the cost and totally indispensable in my workshop.
customer_reviews.author: FRED

customer_reviews.title: same size head as the 12 oz.
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is considered to be the big brother of the 12 oz. model. It packs a good balanced punch that won't destroy the butt ends of your chisels. I purchased the 18 oz. 1st and within 2 weeks ordered the 12 oz. Note that the heads of the 18 and 12 oz. mallets are identical in size, and I like their smaller profile so that I can see my work. They complement each other well and should provide me with years of service. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: this is my first mallet of this type and now i wonder what the hell i was waiting for, awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hepler

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love these mallets! This one is my second one and I'm ordering another size, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike SL

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Essential to the woodworker, this is a sturdy, softer and quiet mallet that does not sacrifice any driving force.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Pure quality
customer_reviews.text: Best mallet I ever had. You’d be amazed at how effortless you work and be with the proper tools.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: The rubber part is thin and as hard as stone!
customer_reviews.text: With round head you'd better watch out don't hammer your own hand ..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but still too loud for me..
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it as it was too loud to use in my apartment without disturbing my neighbors. It's not as "quiet " as I had hoped- but it is EXTREMELY well made and balanced. A beautiful tool and real pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mallet
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is great I can see how this will last for years
customer_reviews.author: Law owl

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to a solid wood mallet
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to a solid wood mallet...I bought this to replace my Pfeil brand mallet, which was dented up pretty bad. Glad I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Try it and you will never look back
customer_reviews.text: I am currently Building/Carving a Rocking Horse for my granddaughter. I absolutely love my "wood is Good" Mallet. The Difference between conventional square head Timber mallet is no force required and each strike is smack on when doing detailed carving. - Awesome. Bottom Line: "Squarehead" for chiseling joints - Roundhead for precise Wood carving...
customer_reviews.author: visi

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Have used it for months and it still has no big mars or scratches in it. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: william dussault

customer_reviews.title: I like the round mallet
customer_reviews.text: I like the round mallet. I had previously always used a dead blow mallet for chisel work. It turns out that I like this more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: After much investigation, I chose this 18 oz. mallet over the many to pick from. I was not disappointed in any way! It's weight is perfect for my relief sign carving and I immediately noticed the lack of stress on my hand/arm that I had previously experienced with my wooden mallet. It doesn't mar the end of my chisels, and the sound is much more tolerable. All in all, it was a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: OpenMinded

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have around
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced in my hand and it looks well made; almost afraid to wear it out. I can't wait to use it
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod De Defi

customer_reviews.title: Brief use from a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It sure beats a hammer. I've never used one of the hardwood mallets which I was up in the air on buying. I like those aesthetically and they're the real deal historically but then I thought this would be cool to have different materials in my shop other than wood, metal, and glue. Feels good in the hand and I imagine it's not as loud as a wood mallet. Try it out and hit a chisel a few times. It won't hurt it and you can always return it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Savage

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality. Excellent Value for the Money. A+++
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Superb heft and weight. Love the quality. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Get this mallet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mallet. Very comfortable. Feels good in your hand. Good heft.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Manning

customer_reviews.title: great for timber framing...
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently building a 8x10 shed with timber framing joinery. I have a wooden mallet, but this mallet is much better. The 18-oz weight is sufficient for chiseling into red and white oak. It's easier on my hands and shoulders. I'm considering getting the 12 oz size for other uses. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any fine wood working..
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful wooden mallet, I mean this thing feels great in your hand. Thank You Samurai Carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Dobry

customer_reviews.title: Who knee it wasn't my chisels.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a mallet like this you're missing out. I thought my chisels were dull. Turns out my hammers were the problem. This mallet will help you with your chisel work immediately. Buy this now. You will become a believer amd immediate fam.
customer_reviews.author: Mjacob1373

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Does not marr wood. Very nice weight and feel. I LOVE this mallet. Very happy with this purchase. Great for chisles.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Here's a guide on how to tap those chisels.
customer_reviews.text: Its a mallet... there is not much to it right, wrong. Unless you want to pay way to much for a mallet, this is a deal. Great balance, grip and no worries about the mallet causing issues, this mallet leaves it to the chisel to do the work, it just helps guide it along.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Glancy

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mallet. I was skeptical of the urethane coating. Some woodworkers love it, but some hate it. I love it. Perfect weight.
customer_reviews.author: Harry T. Dubetz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. I've done so much woodworking in the past ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I've done so much woodworking in the past I don't know how I got along without this. It is the perfect weight for chiseling. I think the 12 oz would be too light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Workmenship
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this on one project so far but I do like it. It's easier on me and my tools than the solid wood one it joined.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Everything  I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it'll last forever, as many say it does..
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Vine-Akuh

customer_reviews.title: feels so nice in the hand
customer_reviews.text: My first Mallet, feels so nice in the hand, I just want to hit things with it! I don't have much experience to compare it to... but I do really like it with my chisel/gouge set that I have used for a while to carve letters (previously with just arm strength).
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Lee

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves how this mallet feels & that it doesnt dent the wood. :)
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: comfortable grip and
customer_reviews.text: Used to use a hammer with my chisels. I will never do that again. Well balanced, comfortable grip and, this might sound goofy, quieter. I built a skin on frame kayak a few years ago and can still hear the ringing of metal on metal, mortising all of those dozens of ribs.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rentmeester

customer_reviews.title: Happy with buy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mallet for wood working projects.. Very solid and well made. For "nudging" things in place it's my go to tool. Happy with buy.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Bad shipping vs quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with handle damaged. Looks great but doubt that it is usable. Certainly is uncomfortable to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mallet. Well worth the money, and now just have to get it in some other sizes/weights.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I can dig this mallet
customer_reviews.text: Great mallet! I like the weight as a smaller mallet for more detailed work!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Parent

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubt if I would like this mallet, but it works great. Feels good in my hands, and seems effortless to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Guy Mallet
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy and I like this mallet. It fits my hand and style very well. Plenty of heft if I need it but I can also control it well for just the light tap I might need while chiseling.
customer_reviews.author: md11flyer

customer_reviews.title: First and last, you'll have to buy
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, good balance, and easy to use. I'm very happy with this mallet, and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great, ergonomic mallet.
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is a joy to use. I have completed some light chisel work with it, and the heavy weight produces clean results with a few light taps.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeSellier

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet
customer_reviews.text: I just got this so I can’t speak to any longevity but I already love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Feels great in the hand, well balanced and useful with my chisels.
customer_reviews.author: DadeCityJeepster

customer_reviews.title: great mallet! I've used it to chop a bunch ...
customer_reviews.text: great mallet! I've used it to chop a bunch of dovetails and found it to be nicely balanced and much quieter than my wood version
customer_reviews.author: mike walsh

customer_reviews.title: Feel good mallet turned into a rattle.............
customer_reviews.text: After using this mallet the first time to chip out some hard rock maple it began to rattle inside. Not sure what is in there to do that but it has become a nuisance to use ever since then.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good balance and feel
customer_reviews.text: Well-made, good balance and feel. I spent three hours hogging out mortises with this yesterday. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Moburner

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this and is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: A personal review of the Wood is Good 18 ounce mallet
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mallet. Its great for chisel work on hand made dovetails (right weight and feel). It appears to be a quality item and I'm just really glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: The Happy Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Won’t have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in the hand. Have hit it hard making a trestle table and it has held up with no marring on the surface. Would buy again but I bet I won’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: mike dirks

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't killed me... yet...
customer_reviews.text: It a mallet and I hit wooden things with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Moore

customer_reviews.title: best mallet i've ever used
customer_reviews.text: wonderful... well balanced and very comfortable for my 7.5 size hands
customer_reviews.author: yinn2yangTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet nice balance and weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for general chisel work. I was looking for something that would last a long time and would be quieter than a wood mallet as I have a child at home and commonly work when he is asleep. I have put this through its paces and can say that it stands up well and works great. I have used this as the mallet to cut the mortices for my roubo workbench with a 5" thick top and it shows no sign of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Marshall

customer_reviews.title: The Product title says it all
customer_reviews.text: I needed a precise mallet for my smaller wood working projects and this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Ed P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This mallet performes very well and does not damage the handles, takes a beating and keeps going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much heavier than stated
customer_reviews.text: I have the entire line of Wood is Good mallets, and the stated weight vs the actual weight can vary a little, but this 18oz mallet actually weight in at almost 24oz - that's about 30% heavier and that's a large difference in the feel of the mallet. I've written to Woodcraft (who now owns the manufacturer of Wood is Good products) but I haven't heard back yet. For now, I'm very disappointed in the weight discrepancy, and believe their quality control needs some work.
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioTgr

customer_reviews.title: Nice heft and feel to the mallet
customer_reviews.text: Nice heft and feel to the mallet. With the limited use so far no problems at all and still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Zoomie

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Great product didn’t realize how handy or how often I would use
customer_reviews.author: Allan L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is the right weight for carving the japanese style into wood...
customer_reviews.author: Barkley B.

customer_reviews.title: Wood Is Good WD205 Mallet, 18-Ounce
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid mallet that doesn't damage the chisel handles, and seems to have the right amount of weight to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice mallet for a good price. Arrived on time and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Kibler

customer_reviews.title: makes the work so easy. feels good oin your hand too
customer_reviews.text: makes the work so easy. feels good oin your hand too.
customer_reviews.author: N. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very vell made and has a high quality feel. I am using it for bench work with my chisels for cleaning out tenons etc...
customer_reviews.author: Neil Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mallet!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mallet! I'm a professional carpenter, and I can't believe I waited this long to switch from a hammer to this mallet. If you chisel on any regularity, get it!
customer_reviews.author: William C. Mahin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was planning to buy a wooden mallet but this synthetic and wood mallet is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great tool. Fits my hand. Fit and finish are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nels brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loe this mallet. I'll most likely purchase another heavier one down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and finish, fits comfortably in the hand and is heavy enough for most work.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Weight Error
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice mallet but the weight of the one I ordered was 22oz. not 18 oz. The quality is so good I will keep the mallet and look for a lighter one around 12 oz.
customer_reviews.author: NancyLynn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: As promised it is really more Quiet as compared to my wooden one.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Savastano

customer_reviews.title: I'm a wood worker and this mallet is great. One thing is it doesn't make the noise ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wood worker and this mallet is great. One thing is it doesn't make the noise that other mallets make.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great chisel mallet
customer_reviews.text: I only give this four stars instead of five because it is a little pricey. This is a great chisel and mortice mallet. I don't think I would go under the 18 ounce unless you are a wood carver.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Harwood

customer_reviews.title: Just the Best!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and while you can always buy a cheaper mallet to use with your investment of chisels, this is the one that you need! It is just so well made! Buy this one! Girl Chiseler!
customer_reviews.author: Lilli Castaldo

product_meta.title: Wood Is Good WD205 Mallet, 18-Ounce
product_meta.description:
Item Package Quantity:1FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This Wood Is Good 18-Ounce Mallet is guaranteed unbreakable. The head is made of a tough urethane material designed to be quiet and yet able to transmit the maximum blow to the tool. The handle is beautifully turned out of selected New England hardwood and is polish sanded. Urethane head is 2-3/4-inch diameter. Made in USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars252 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
